* Represents a command that adds a new task to the task list.
* Executes the command to add a task to the task list and update storage.
* @param tasks   The task list to which the task will be added.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage handler to save the task.
* @return false, as this command does not terminate the program.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs while updating storage.
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException {
* Represents a command that exits the program.
* Executes the command to display a farewell message and terminate the program.
* @param tasks   The task list (not used in this command).
* @param ui      The user interface to display the farewell message.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used in this command).
* @return true, indicating that the program should terminate.
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents an executable command within the application.
* Subclasses must implement the {@code execute} method to define command behavior.
* Executes the command with the given task list, user interface, and storage handler.
* @param tasks   The task list on which the command operates.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage handler to update saved tasks if needed.
* @return true if the command terminates the program, otherwise false.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs while executing the command.
public abstract boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException;
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Executes the command to remove a task from the task list and update storage.
* @param tasks   The task list from which the task will be removed.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage handler to update the saved tasks.
* @return false, as this command does not terminate the program.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs while updating storage.
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException {
* Represents a command to find tasks containing a specific keyword.

* @param ui      The user interface to display results.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used in this command).
* @return false, as this command does not terminate the program.
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("\tThere are no entries that contain this keyword");
* Represents a command to mark or unmark a task as completed.
